title: How to Remove Uploaded Contacts from Facebook Messenger on Your iPhone or iPad

steps.title: Open Messenger on your iPhone or iPad.
steps.content: Open Messenger on your iPhone or iPad. It's the blue, purple, and white chat bubble icon with a lightning bolt inside. This opens Messenger to the Chats tab. [1] X Research source If you’re not already open to the Chats tab, tap the blue bubble at the bottom left corner of the screen. This method will stop your iPhone or iPad from continuously uploading contacts to Messenger, although you’ll also have to turn off this setting in Facebook for it to work fully. To actually delete the contacts that have already been uploaded, see Deleting All Contacts in the Messenger App .

steps.title: Tap the ☰ menu.
steps.content: Tap the ☰ menu. It's at the top-left corner of the Chats tab.

steps.title: Open Settings.
steps.content: Open Settings . Tap the Settings icon at the top of the menu, next to your profile picture.

steps.title: Open the Meta Accounts Center.
steps.content: Open the Meta Accounts Center. Scroll down to the bottom of the menu and tap the box that says Accounts Center .

steps.title: Tap Your information and permissions.
steps.content: Tap Your information and permissions . It’s under the header that says Account settings .

steps.title: Select Upload contacts.
steps.content: Select Upload contacts . This is the last option in the menu.

steps.title: Select your Messenger account.
steps.content: Select your Messenger account. On the next screen, you’ll see a list of all your connected Meta accounts. Tap on the Messenger account associated with your iPhone or iPad.

steps.title: Tap Upload contacts to turn it off.
steps.content: Tap Upload contacts to turn it off. If this setting is on, you’ll see On next to the Upload contacts option. Tap it to turn it off. You’ll have to do the same thing on all devices that are logged into this Messenger account. You’ll also need to turn off the Upload Contacts setting in the Facebook app .

steps.title: Use this workaround if these steps don’t work.
steps.content: Use this workaround if these steps don’t work. As of June 2024, there’s a glitch in the Messenger app that may prevent this process from working correctly. Hopefully it will be fixed soon, but in the meantime, here’s how to work around it: Open the Facebook app on your iPhone or iPad. Tap the ☰ Menu button in the bottom right corner. Scroll down and select Settings & privacy > Settings . Tap the Accounts Center box at the top of the menu. Tap Your information and permissions in the options under the Account settings header. Tap Upload contacts and select your Messenger account from the list. If it says On next to Upload contacts , tap it to turn this setting off.

steps.title: Open the ☰ menu in Facebook.
steps.content: Open the ☰ menu in Facebook. Launch the Facebook app on your iPhone or iPad, then tap the ☰ Menu button in the lower right corner. [2] X Research source This setting will prevent Facebook from continuously uploading the contacts on your iPhone or iPad. You’ll also need to turn off this setting in Messenger and in Facebook on any other devices connected to the same Facebook and Messenger account.

steps.title: Tap Settings & privacy.
steps.content: Tap Settings & privacy . Scroll down in the menu and select Settings & privacy .

steps.title: Open Settings.
steps.content: Open Settings . It’s the first option in the expanded Settings & privacy menu.

steps.title: Tap the Meta Accounts Center box.
steps.content: Tap the Meta Accounts Center box. It’s at the top of the new screen that will open up when you tap Settings .

steps.title: Open Your information and permissions.
steps.content: Open Your information and permissions . Scroll down and find this option under the Account settings header. Tap on it to open a new menu.

steps.title: Tap Upload contacts.
steps.content: Tap Upload contacts . It’s the last option on the menu.

steps.title: Select your Facebook account.
steps.content: Select your Facebook account. A list of your connected Meta accounts will open. Select your Facebook account from the list.

steps.title: Toggle off the switch next to Upload contacts.
steps.content: Toggle off the switch next to Upload contacts . If this switch is gray, this setting is already off. If it’s green, the setting is on. Tap it to toggle it off.

steps.title: Go to the Chats tab in Messenger.
steps.content: Go to the Chats tab in Messenger. Open the Messenger app on your iPhone or iPad. If you’re not already in Chats , tap the blue speech bubble icon on the bottom left corner of the screen to go there. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Tap the ☰ menu.
steps.content: Tap the ☰ menu. It’s in the top left corner of the screen.

steps.title: Open the Settings menu.
steps.content: Open the Settings menu. Tap the blue Settings icon at the top right corner of the menu that expands, next to your name and profile icon.

steps.title: Tap Accounts Center.
steps.content: Tap Accounts Center . You’ll need to scroll down to the bottom of the Settings menu to find it. Tap the Meta Accounts Center box or the See more in Accounts Center link to open your Meta Accounts Center menu.

steps.title: Open Your information and permissions.
steps.content: Open Your information and permissions . It’s in the list of options under the Account settings header.

steps.title: Tap Upload contacts.
steps.content: Tap Upload contacts . It’s the last option in the menu.

steps.title: Select your Messenger account.
steps.content: Select your Messenger account. If you have several Meta accounts, select the one associated with the Messenger app on your iPhone or iPad.

steps.title: Tap Manage Contacts.
steps.content: Tap Manage Contacts . This will take you to your Facebook account in a browser, where you might be prompted to log in with your email or phone number and password.

steps.title: Select Delete all contacts.
steps.content: Select Delete all contacts . In the Manage your uploaded contacts page, click the button that says Delete all contacts . There’s no option to delete these contacts individually. If you still have Upload contacts turned on in your Messenger or Facebook settings, you’ll need to turn that off to keep the contacts you just deleted from reappearing. Go back to your Accounts Center and make sure that option is toggled off in both accounts.

steps.title: Try this workaround if these instructions don’t work.
steps.content: Try this workaround if these instructions don’t work. When we tested Meta’s instructions for deleting your contacts in Messenger, we encountered a glitch that kept redirecting us back to the Messenger Settings menu. While this bug will hopefully be fixed soon, you can also access these settings through the Facebook app if you need to. Here’s how: Open Facebook on your iPhone or iPad and tap the ☰ Menu in the bottom right corner of the screen. Scroll down and tap Settings & privacy , then tap Settings . Tap the Accounts Center box at the top of the menu. Tap Your information and permissions . Tap Upload contacts . It’s at the bottom of the menu. Select your Messenger account . Tap Manage contacts . Log into Facebook in your mobile browser if prompted, then tap the Delete all contacts button. Go back to the Contact upload screen in your Account Center and make sure Upload contacts is set to Off .

steps.title: Open the Settings app on your iPhone or iPad.
steps.content: Open the Settings app on your iPhone or iPad. You can also keep Facebook and Messenger from accessing your Contacts in your device’s settings. To do so, you’ll need to launch the Settings app .

steps.title: Scroll down and tap Facebook.
steps.content: Scroll down and tap Facebook . Keep scrolling down in the Settings menu until you find a long list of apps installed on your device. Tap on Facebook .

steps.title: Toggle off the switch next to Contacts.
steps.content: Toggle off the switch next to Contacts . On the next screen, you’ll see a list of apps and utilities under the header Allow Facebook to Access . If the toggle switch next to Contacts is green, tap it to turn it off.

steps.title: Repeat this process with the Messenger app.
steps.content: Repeat this process with the Messenger app. Tap the back arrow at the top of the screen to return to the main Settings menu, then scroll down in the list of apps and tap Messenger . Make sure Contacts is toggled off in the list of apps under Allow Messenger to Access .

steps.title: Open Messenger on your iPhone or iPad.
steps.content: Open Messenger on your iPhone or iPad. It's the blue chat bubble icon with a white lightning bolt inside. You'll usually find it on the home screen. This opens Messenger to the Chats tab. This method will help you block a contact on Messenger without blocking or unfriending them on Facebook. The person you block will no longer be able to contact you or see you online. [4] X Research source They also won't appear on your Messenger contact list. The person will not be notified that you've blocked them, but they will see an error when they try to message you.

steps.title: Tap a conversation with the person you want to block.
steps.content: Tap a conversation with the person you want to block.

steps.title: Tap the person's name at the top of the conversation.
steps.content: Tap the person's name at the top of the conversation.

steps.title: Scroll down and tap Block.
steps.content: Scroll down and tap Block .

steps.title: Tap Block messages and calls.
steps.content: Tap Block messages and calls . A confirmation message will appear.

steps.title: Tap Block to confirm.
steps.content: Tap Block to confirm. This selects the Block option and prevents the person from being able to contact you on Messenger. A message will also pop up, giving you the option to report the person or delete the chat. If you decide to unblock the person in the future: Tap the ☰ Menu button at the top left corner of the Chats tab, tap the Settings icon, and select Privacy & safety . Tap Blocked accounts and select the person you want to unblock. Select Unblock messages and calls .

steps.title: Restrict someone to remove them from Chats without blocking them.
steps.content: Restrict someone to remove them from Chats without blocking them. If you don’t want to see messages from a contact but aren’t ready to completely block them, you can use the Restrict option instead. You won’t get notifications if they try to call or message you, and you won’t see your conversation with them in Messenger. You also won’t be able to call them or send them messages. [5] X Research source From the Chats tab in Messenger, tap on a conversation with the person you want to restrict. Tap their profile picture at the top of the conversation. Scroll down and tap Restrict . It’s near the bottom of the menu, under the Privacy & support header. You can always unrestrict them by going to Chats > ☰ Menu > Settings > Privacy & safety > Restricted accounts . Tap the person to open your chat with them, then tap Unrestrict at the bottom of the chat window.
